title: 1  R and Base R Graphics
crumbs: 1  R and Base R Graphics

title: 16  week05placeholder
text:
Understand what linkage disequilibrium (LD) represents biologically
Distinguish common LD measures (r² vs D′)
Learn how LD is used to interpret GWAS lead variants

title: 16  week05placeholder
text:
16.2 Conceptual overview

16.2.1 What LD tells you
Explain here what LD captures, why nearby variants are correlated, and how population history affects LD patterns.


16.2.2 r² vs D′
Explain: - what each measure captures - when one is misleading - why r² is usually preferred for association interpretation

title: 16  week05placeholder
section: 16.3 Practical workflow: annotating a GWAS hit
text:
16.3 Practical workflow: annotating a GWAS hit

Identify the lead SNP
Retrieve LD proxies in the relevant ancestry
Annotate proxies (VEP, regulatory context, eQTLs)
Integrate evidence into a mechanistic hypothesis

title: 16  week05placeholder
text:
16.4 Self-check prompts (for students)

Why does LD decay with distance?
Why might LD structure differ across ancestries?
When might a non-coding proxy SNP be more plausible than the lead SNP?

title: 16  week05placeholder
text:
16.5 References / notes
Add references, links, or citations here.
